ygData.subject: tip for lvl 8 wiz.  **spoiler**
ygData.msgSnippet: Wow, I m a little behind on the mail.  (so MANY posts to this list! =) But anyway Cornn, I just wanted to give a fellow Wiz encouragment.  I think lvl 8-10 was
ygData.messageBody:
Wow, I'm a little behind on the mail. (so MANY posts to this list! =)
But anyway Cornn, I just wanted to give a fellow Wiz encouragment. I
think lvl 8-10 was my toughest levels as well. Slow going and you
don't have enough punch to survive on your own much. I just recently
achieved 12 and it's getting to be a LOT more fun.

Head over to the Felwithe area instead of Freeport. Crushbone is a
good key area and the goblin camps in ButcherBlock are good too. I
don't know what it is, but it seems the people in Freeport are not
quite as friendly (no offense =). Not to mention the Sand Giants and
Madmen can get downright dangerous for a Wiz over there, IMHO. If
you have a strong, trusted party, you might venture to Steamfont for
hunting Minotaurs. They give you Mino Axes with will fetch you ~10pp
over in Queynos or about 5pp in the local area.

It was real dangerous for me to travel to Queynos, even in an
experienced party. I don't regret seeing new sites, but I should have
stayed home till at least 12 lvl.

-- LimDul
12lvl High Elf Wiz
Veeshan

>
>Message: 5
> Date: 18 Apr 1999 23:53:54 -0000
> From: ulrich1@...
>Subject: What should I do
>
>Ok I have a problem....
>
>I am a level 8 Human Wizard in Freeport, Xegony server. My problem is
I do not have any friends playing EQ. My game so far has been solo.
The levels are coming very slow. I have grouped up with people several
times. This turns into a nightmare. Most of the time we all just run
around aimlessly, it takes so much time just to get sometime going its
not really worth it.
>
>Anyone have any suggestions? I have a friend who is going to buy the
game soon, its just hard to wait. It took me 1 week to level up from 7
to 8.
>Not to mention Humans can't see in the dark.
>
>Sorry for the long winning post.
>
>Thanks
>
>Cornn (I love this game)
>
>
>_____________________________________________________________________
__________
>_____________________________________________________________________
__________
>
>Message: 6
> Date: Sun, 18 Apr 1999 20:38:18 -0400
> From: "Chris Trubiani" <u1607755@...>
>Subject: Re: What should I do
>
>Well, I have no good news for you. I found lvl 8 and 9 to be my
hardest thus
>far simply because when you go solo everything is either too hard, or
too
>easy.. there aren't many in betweens. (at least that is what I found
for
>the creatures around the neriak/freeport area) The way I made it
through
>was by meeting people who played the game well, and we went out and
hunted.
>For a lower lvl wizard going solo can be disastrous.. at 14 I still
have
>tons of problems solo. The only advice I can give you, is keep
trying in
>the parties.. eventually you will find some good people who play
well, and
>who you get along with. Then when you play after that you'll know
who to
>look for a little better so that you can get back together as a good
group.
>Sorry I have nothing really conforting to say.. but grouping is a
major part
>of playing a wizard. If it's impossible to find anyone around the
freeport
>area, then you try moving to another city. Travelling to Qeynos is
not
>extremely hard from freeport (1 really hard zone) and I'm sure you
could
>find someone there to bind you, and hopefully more people who you
would be
>able to group with. Good luck to you...
>
>
>Tandayen, Dark Elf Wizard
>
>
